David waged several successful military campaigns, annexing [[Philistia]], [[Edom]], [[Moab]], [[Ammon]], and parts of ancient [[Aram]] (roughly modern [[Syria]]) known as [[Aram-Zobah]], and [[Aram-Damascus]]. Aram itself became a [[puppet state|vassal state]] of Israel under David.
Perhaps the most important event of David's reign was his capture of [[Jerusalem]] from the Canaanite Jebusites. By moving his capital from [[Hebron]] and making [[Jerusalem]] his capital, David ensured its lasting importance as a religious center.
